explanation:
The correct calculation adds the intersection (15) and black car only (8) regions: \(15 + 8 = 23\). 
The student used only the intersection value (15), omitting the "black car only" portion. 
This shows they misinterpreted the question as requesting the overlap (both 4x4 and black car) rather than the total black car owners. 
The error directly stems from conflating the intersection value with the full set value, as they treated the shared region as the complete answer instead of a component. 
This differs from "forgets to include the intersection" (which would yield 8) or "mixes union/intersection" (which might involve adding all regions). 
The student's specific confusion was about what constitutes the total membership of a single set in a Venn diagram.
